job description:
Summary: Data Trust is currently seeking a Data Analyst – Outside Groups, a full-time position, that will be responsible for working under the Deputy Director of External Support fielding requests from clients relating to voter and consumer data. The Data Analyst – Outside Groups will be responsible for managing client relationships and fulfilling various requests. They will be a motivated self-starter with an interest in politics and data.

About Us: Data Trust is a young dynamic political data organization focused on center-right leaning advocacy and support.

Reporting: The Data Analyst – Outside Groups will report directly to the Deputy Director of External Support, as well as the Director of External Support.

Responsibilities:
  • Analyze election results and other datasets to provide actionable insights to clients, and proactively solicit client feedback.
  • Become comfortable using SQL to manipulate Data Trust’s data into meaningful reports and tables for clients.
  • Apply political knowledge and an understanding of the current climate to aid clients with strategic decisions making use of data and technical skills.
  • Utilize thousands of political, demographic and consumer data points to create actionable voter universes that allow clients to achieve electoral goals.
  • Adapt to ever-changing client needs and build a knowledge of campaign strategies and how Data Trust can help clients carry out voter outreach operations.
  • Engage in creative destruction and entrepreneurialism to assist the External Support team with developing new products and processes to serve client needs.
  • Serve as Data Trust’s point of contact with client organizations when needed.


Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate will be professional and reliable and display strong communication skills.
  • The ability to effectively multitask while meeting deadlines.
  • 0-2 years of professional experience, preferably in campaigning/electoral politics, or political data.
  • Possess an understanding of how data educates and interacts with the political process on all levels.
  • Prior experience with a political campaign or committee is helpful.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
  • A willingness to work longer-than-usual hours if needed, responsiveness, and a very close attention to detail.
